text: Then Solomon the son of David was confirmed in his kingdom: and the Lord his God was with him, and magnified him highly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands, and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to all the governors in all Israel, even the chief fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon and all the Congregation with him went to the high place that was at Gibeon: for there was the Tabernacle of the Congregation of God which Moses the servant of the Lord had made in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Ark of God had David brought up from Kirjath Jearim, when David had made preparation for it: for he had pitched a tent for it in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the brazen altar that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur had made, did he set before the Tabernacle of the Lord: and Solomon and the Congregation sought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon offered there before the Lord upon the brazen altar that was in the Tabernacle of the Congregation: even a thousand burnt offerings offered he upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast showed great mercy unto David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O Lord God, let thy promise unto David my father be true: for thou hast made me King over a great people, like to the dust of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and go in before this people: for who can judge this thy great people?
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart, and thou hast not asked riches, treasures nor honor, nor the lives of thine enemies, neither yet hast asked long life, but hast asked for thee wisdom and knowledge, that thou mightest judge my people, over whom I have made thee King,
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee, and I will give thee riches and treasures and honor, so that there hath not been the like among the kings which were before thee, neither after thee shall there be the like.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon came from the high place that was at Gibeon, to Jerusalem from before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and reigned over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon gathered the chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he placed in the chariot cities, and with the King at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king gave gold and silver at Jerusalem as stone, and gave cedar trees as the wild fig trees, that are abundantly in the plain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and fine linen: the King’s merchants received the fine linen for a price.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came up also and brought out of Egypt some chariot, worth six hundred shekels of silver, that is an horse for an hundred and fifty: and thus they brought horses to all the kings of the Hittites, and to the kings of Aram by their means.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon determined to build an house for the Name of the Lord, and an house for his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon told out seventy thousand that bare burdens, and fourscore thousand men to hew stones in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou hast done to David my father, and didst send him cedar trees to build him an house to dwell in so do to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I build an house unto the Name of the Lord my God, to sanctify it unto him, and to burn sweet incense before him, and for the continual showbread, and for the burnt offerings of the morning and evening, on the Sabbath days, and in the new months, and in the solemn feasts of the Lord our God: this is a perpetual thing for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house which I build, is great: for great is our God above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is he then that can be able to build him an house, when the heaven and the heaven of heavens can not contain him? who am I then that I should build him an house? but I do it to burn incense before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send me now therefore a cunning man that can work in gold, in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and in crimson and blue silk, and that can grave in graven work with the cunning men that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father hath prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send me also cedar trees, fir trees and Algummim trees from Lebanon: for I know that thy servants can skill to hew timber in Lebanon: and behold, my servants shall be with thine,
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may prepare me timber in abundance: for the house which I do build, is great and wonderful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, I will give to thy servants the cutters and the hewers of timber twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Huram king of Tyre answered in writing which he sent to Solomon, Because the Lord hath loved his people, he hath made thee King over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Huram said moreover, Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, which made the heaven and the earth, and that hath given unto David the King a wise son, that hath discretion, prudence and understanding to build an house for the Lord, and a palace for his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore I have sent a wise man, and of understanding of my father Huram’s,
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of a woman, of the daughters of Dan: and his father was a man of Tyre, and he can skill to work in gold, in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue silk, and in fine linen, and in crimson, and can grave in all graven works, and broider in all broidered work that shall be given him, with thy cunning men, and with the cunning men of my lord David thy father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore the wheat and the barley, the oil and the wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we will cut wood in Lebanon as much as thou shalt need, and will bring it to thee in rafts by the sea to Japho, so thou mayest carry them to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon numbered all the strangers that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering that his father David had numbered them: and they were found an hundred and three and fifty thousand, and six hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set seventy thousand of them to the burden, and fourscore thousand to hew stones in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to cause the people to work.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon began to build the house of the Lord in Jerusalem, in mount Moriah which had been declared unto David his father, in the place that David prepared in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began to build in the second month and the second day, in the fourth year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the measures whereon Solomon grounded to build the house of God: the length of cubits after the first measure was threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the porch that was before the length in the front of the breadth was twenty cubits, and the height was an hundred and twenty, and he overlaid it within with pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the greater house he ceiled with fir tree which he overlaid with good gold, and graved thereon palm trees and chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold was gold of Parvaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The house, I say, the beams, posts, and walls thereof and the doors thereof overlaid he with gold, and graved Cherubims upon the walls.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also the house of the most holy place: the length thereof was in the front of the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with the best gold, of six hundred talents.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold, and he overlaid the chambers with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the house of the most holy place he made two Cherubims wrought like children, and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the wings of the Cherubims were twenty cubits long: the one wing was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house, and the other wing five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other Cherub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise the wing of the other Cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house, and the other wing five cubits, joining to the wing of the other Cherub.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wings of these Cherubims were spread abroad twenty cubits, they stood on their feet, and their faces were toward the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also the veil of blue silk and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought Cherubims thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made before the house two pillars of five and thirty cubits high: and the chapiter that was upon the top of each of them, was five cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also chains for the Oracle, and put them on the heads of the pillars, and made an hundred pomegranates, and put them among the chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set up the pillars before the Temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left, and called that on the right hand Jachin, and that on the left hand Boaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made an altar of brass twenty cubits long, and twenty cubits broad, and ten cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made a molten Sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and five cubits high: and a line of thirty cubits did compass it about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And under it was the fashion of oxen, which did compass it round about, ten in a cubit compassing the Sea about: two rows of oxen were cast when it was molten.
speaker: Narrator

text: It stood upon twelve oxen: three looked toward the North, and three looked toward the West, and three looked toward the South, and three looked toward the East, and the Sea stood above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the thickness thereof was an hand breadth, and the brim thereof was like the work of the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies: it contained three thousand baths.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also ten caldrons, and put five on the right hand, and five on the left, to wash in them, and to cleanse in them that which appertained to the burnt offerings: but the Sea was for the Priests to wash in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ten candlesticks of gold (according to their form) and put them in the Temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ten tables, and put them in the Temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left: and he made an hundred basins of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the court of the Priests, and the great court and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors thereof with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the Sea on the right side Eastward toward the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Huram made pots and besoms and basins, and Huram finished the work that he should make for King Solomon for the house of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: To wit, two pillars, and the bowls and the chapiters on the top of the two pillars, and two grates to cover the two bowls of the chapiters which were upon the top of the pillars:
speaker: Narrator

text: And four hundred pomegranates for the two grates, two rows of pomegranates for every grate to cover the two bowls of the chapiters, that were upon the pillars.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also bases, and made caldrons upon the bases:
speaker: Narrator

text: And a Sea, and twelve bulls under it:
speaker: Narrator

text: Pots also and besoms, and flesh hooks, and all these vessels made Huram his father to King Solomon for the house of the Lord of shining brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the plain of Jordan did the King cast them in clay between Succoth and Zeredathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance: for the weight of brass could not be reckoned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon made all the vessels that were for the house of God: the golden altar also and the tables, whereon the showbread stood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the candlesticks with their lamps, to burn them after the manner before the Oracle, of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the flowers and the lamps, and the snuffers of gold, which was fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hooks, and the basins, and the spoons, and the ash pans of pure gold: the entry also of the house and doors thereof within, even of the most holy place: and the doors of the house, to wit, of the Temple were of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: So was all the work finished that Solomon made for the house of the Lord, and Solomon brought in the things that David his father had dedicated, with the silver and the gold, and all the vessels, and put them among the treasures of the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon assembled the Elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the chief fathers of the children of Israel unto Jerusalem, to bring up the Ark of the covenant of the Lord from the city of David, which is Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men of Israel assembled unto the king at the feast: it was in the seventh month.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the Elders of Israel came, and the Levites took up the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they carried up the Ark, and the Tabernacle of the Congregation: and all the holy vessels that were in the Tabernacle, those did the Priests and Levites bring up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And king Solomon and all the Congregation of Israel that were assembled unto him, were before the Ark, offering sheep and bullocks, which could not be told nor numbered for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Priests brought the Ark of the covenant of the Lord unto his place, into the Oracle of the house, into the most Holy place, even under the wings of the Cherubims.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Cherubims stretched out their wings over the place of the Ark, and the Cherubims covered the Ark and the bars thereof above.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they drew out the bars, that the ends of the bars might be seen out of the Ark before the Oracle, but they were not seen without: and there they are unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nothing was in the Ark, save the two Tables, which Moses gave at Horeb, where the Lord made a covenant with the children of Israel when they came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Priests were come out of the Sanctuary (for all the Priests that were present, were sanctified and did not wait by course.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites the singers of all sorts, as of Asaph, of Heman, of Jeduthun, and of their sons and of their brethren, being clad in fine linen, stood with cymbals, and with viols, and harps at the East end of the Altar, and with them an hundred and twenty Priests blowing with trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were as one, blowing trumpets, and singing, and made one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the Lord, and when they lifted up their voice with trumpets, and with cymbals, and with instruments of music, and when they praised the Lord, singing, For he is good, because his mercy lasteth forever) then the house, even the house of the Lord was filled with a cloud,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the Priests could not stand to minister, because of the cloud: for the glory of the Lord had filled the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon said, The Lord hath said that he would dwell in the dark cloud:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have built thee an house to dwell in, an habitation for thee to dwell in forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King turned his face, and blessed all the Congregation of Israel (for all the Congregation of Israel stood there.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who spake with his mouth unto David my father, and hath with his hand fulfilled it, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the day that I brought my people out of the land of Egypt, I chose no city of all the tribes of Israel to build an house, that my Name might be there, neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my Name might be there, and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was in the heart of David my father to build an house unto the Name of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to David my father, Whereas it was in thine heart to build an house unto my Name, thou diddest well, that thou wast so minded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, thou shalt not build the house, but thy son, which shall come out of thy loins, he shall build an house unto my Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath performed his word that he spake: and I am risen up in the room of David my father, and am set on the throne of Israel as the Lord promised, and have built an house to the Name of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have set the Ark there, wherein is the covenant of the Lord, that he made with the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king stood before the altar of the Lord, in the presence of all the Congregation of Israel, and stretched out his hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: (For Solomon had made a brazen scaffold, and set it in the midst of the court, of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits of height, and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the Congregation of Israel, and stretched out his hands toward heaven.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, O Lord God of Israel, there is no God like thee in heaven nor in earth, which keepest covenant and mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou that hast kept with thy servant David my father, that thou hast promised him: for thou spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as appeareth this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now, Lord God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father, that thou hast promised him, saying, Thou shalt not want a man in my sight, that shall sit upon the throne of Israel, so that thy sons take heed to their ways to walk in my Law, as thou hast walked before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Lord God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou spakest unto thy servant David.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Is it true indeed that God will dwell with man on earth? behold, the heavens, and the heavens of heavens are not able to contain thee: how much more unable is this house which I have built?)
speaker: Narrator

text: But have thou respect to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Lord my God, to hear the cry and prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: That thine eyes may be open toward this house day and night, even toward the place, whereof thou hast said, that thou wouldest put thy Name there, that thou mayest hearken unto the prayer, which thy servant prayeth in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear thou therefore the supplication of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, which they pray in this place: and hear thou in the place of thine habitation, even in heaven, and when thou hearest, be merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man shall sin against his neighbor, and he lay upon him an oath to cause him to swear, and the swearer shall come before thine altar in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then hear thou in heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, in recompensing the wicked to bring his way upon his head, and in justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when thy people Israel shall be overthrown before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee, and turn again, and confess thy Name, and pray, and make supplication before thee in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then hear thou in heaven, and be merciful unto the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When heaven shall be shut up, and there shall be no rain, because they have sinned against thee, and shall pray in this place and confess thy Name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then hear thou in heaven, and pardon the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel (when thou hast taught them the good way wherein they may walk) and give rain upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: When there shall be famine in the land, when there shall be pestilence, blasting, or mildew, when there shall be grasshopper, or caterpillar, when their enemy shall besiege them in the cities of their land, or any plague or any sickness,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what prayer and supplication soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every one shall know his own plague, and his own disease, and shall stretch forth his hands toward this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear thou then in heaven, thy dwelling place, and be merciful, and give every man according unto all his ways, as thou dost know his heart (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of men)
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may fear thee, and walk in thy ways, as long as they live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, as touching the stranger which is not of thy people Israel, who shall come out of a far country for thy great Name’s sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm: when they shall come and pray in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear thou in heaven, thy dwelling place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth for unto thee, that all the people of the earth may know thy Name, and fear thee like thy people Israel, and that they may know that thy Name is called upon in this house which I have built.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thy people shall go out to battle against their enemies, by the way that thou shalt send them, and they pray to thee, in the way toward this city, which thou hast chosen, even toward the house which I have built to thy Name,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their supplication, and judge their cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they sin against thee (for there is no man that sinneth not) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them unto the enemies, and they take them and carry them away captive unto a land far or near,
speaker: Narrator

text: If they turn again to their heart in the land whither they be carried in captives, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have transgressed and have done wickedly,
speaker: Narrator

text: If they turn again to thee with all their heart, and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and toward the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for thy Name,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then hear thou in heaven, in the place of thine habitation, their prayer and their supplication, and judge their cause, and be merciful unto thy people, which have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now my God, I beseech thee, let thine eyes be open, and thine ears attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore arise, O Lord God, to come into thy rest, thou, and the Ark of thy strength: O Lord God, let thy Priests be clothed with salvation, and let thy Saints rejoice in goodness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord God, refuse not the face of thine anointed: remember the mercies promised to David thy servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Solomon had made an end of praying, fire came down from heaven, and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices: and the glory of the Lord filled the house,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the Priests could not enter into the house of the Lord, because the glory of the Lord had filled the Lord’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the children of Israel saw the fire, and the glory of the Lord come down upon the house, they bowed themselves with their faces to the earth upon the pavement, and worshipped and praised the Lord, saying, For he is good, because his mercy lasteth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King and all the people offered sacrifices before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And king Solomon offered a sacrifice of two and twenty thousand bullocks, and an hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Priests waited on their offices, and the Levites with the instruments of music of the Lord, which king David had made to praise the Lord, because his mercy lasteth forever: when David praised God by them, the Priests also blew trumpets over against them: and all they of Israel stood by.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of the Lord: for there he had prepared burnt offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the brazen altar which Solomon had made, was not able to receive the burnt offering, and the meat offering, and the fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon made a feast at that time of seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great Congregation, from the entering in of Hamath, unto the river of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the eight day they made a solemn assembly: for they had made the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the three and twentieth day of the seventh month, he sent the people away into their tents, joyous and with glad heart, because of the goodness that the Lord had done for David and for Solomon, and for Israel his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon finished the house of the Lord, and the king’s house, and all that came into Solomon’s heart to make in the house of the Lord: and he prospered in his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him, I have heard thy prayer, and have chosen this place for myself to be an house of sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I shut the heaven that there be no rain, or if I command the grasshopper to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among my people,
speaker: Narrator

text: If my people, among whom my Name is called upon, do humble themselves, and pray and seek my presence, and turn from their wicked ways, then will I hear in heaven and be merciful to their sin, and will heal their land:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then mine eyes shall be open and mine ears attent unto the prayer made in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have now chosen and sanctified this house, that my Name may be there forever: and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, to do according unto all that I have commanded thee, and shalt observe my statutes and my judgments,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I establish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I made the covenant with David thy father, saying, Thou shalt not want a man to be ruler in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I pluck them up out of my land, which I have given them, and this house which I have sanctified for my Name, will I cast out of my sight, and will make it to be a proverb and a common talk among all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this house which is most high, shall be an astonishment to everyone that passeth by it, so that he shall say, Why hath the Lord done thus to this land, and to this house?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall answer, Because they forsook the Lord God of their fathers, which brought them out of the land of Egypt, and have taken hold on other gods, and have worshipped them, and served them, therefore hath he brought all this evil upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after twenty years when Solomon had built the house of the Lord, and his own house,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon built the cities that Huram gave to Solomon, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon went to Hamath Zobah, and overcame it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built Tadmor in the wilderness, and repaired all the cities of store which he built in Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he built Beth Horon the upper, and Beth Horon the nether, cities defensed with walls, gates and bars:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Baalath, and all the cities of store that Solomon had, and all the chariot cities, and the cities of the horsemen, and every pleasant place that Solomon had a mind to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and throughout all the land of his dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people that were left to the Hittites, and the Amorites, and Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which were not of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: But of their children which were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel had not consumed, even them did Solomon make tributaries until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for his work: for they were men of war, and his chief princes, and the captains of his chariots and of his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: So these were the chief, of the officers which Solomon had, even two hundred and fifty that bare rule over the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh out of the city of David, into the house that he had built for her: for he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel: for it is holy, because that the Ark of the Lord came unto it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings unto the Lord, on the altar of the Lord, which he had built before the porch,
speaker: Narrator

text: To offer according to the commandment of Moses every day, in the Sabbaths, and in the new moons, and in the solemn feasts, three times in the year, that is, in the feast of the Unleavened bread, and in the feast of the Weeks, and in the feast of the Tabernacles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the courses of the Priests to their offices according to the order of David his father, and the Levites in their watches, for to praise and minister before the Priests every day, and the porters by their courses, at every gate: for so was the commandment of David the man of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they declined not from the commandment of the king, concerning the Priests and the Levites, touching all things, and touching the treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Solomon had made provision for all the work from the day of the foundation of the house of the Lord, until it was finished: so the house of the Lord was perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went Solomon to Ezion Geber, and to Eloth by the Sea side in the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Huram sent him by the hands of his servants, ships and servants that had knowledge of the sea: and they went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and brought thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought them to King Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great train, and camels that bare sweet odors and much gold, and precious stones: and when she came to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon declared her all her questions, and there was nothing hid from Solomon, which he declared not unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Queen of Sheba saw the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the meat of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the order of his waiters, and their apparel, and his butlers, and their apparel, and his burnt offerings which he offered in the house of the Lord, and she was greatly astonied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to the King, It was a true word which I heard in mine own land of thy sayings, and of thy wisdom:
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit, I believed not their report, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and behold, the one half of thy great wisdom was not told me: for thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Happy are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, which stand before thee always, and hear thy wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the Lord thy God, which loved thee, to set thee on his throne as king, in the stead of the Lord thy God: because thy God loveth Israel, to establish it forever, therefore hath he made thee king over them, to execute judgments and justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she gave the King sixscore talents of gold, and of sweet odors exceedingly much, and precious stones: neither was there such sweet odors since, as the Queen of Sheba gave unto King Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon which brought gold from Ophir, brought Algummim wood and precious stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King made of the Algummim wood stairs in the house of the Lord, and in the king’s house, and harps and viols for singers: and there was no such seen before in the land of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Solomon gave to the Queen of Sheba every pleasant thing that she asked, besides for that which she had brought unto the king: so she returned and went to her own country, both she, and her servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year, was six hundred threescore and six talents of gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: Besides that which chapmen and merchants brought: and all the Kings of Arabia, and the princes of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold, and six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one target.
speaker: Narrator

text: And three hundred shields of beaten gold: three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield, and the king put them in the house of the wood of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the throne had six steps, with a footstool of gold fastened to the throne, and stays on either side on the place of the seats, and two lions standing by the stays.
speaker: Narrator

text: And twelve lions stood there on the six steps on either side: there was not the like made in any kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all King Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the wood of Lebanon were of pure gold: for silver was nothing esteemed in the days of Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the king’s ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram, every three years once came the ships of Tarshish, and brought gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: So king Solomon excelled all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the Kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom that God had put in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, armor, and sweet odors, horses, and mules, from year to year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon had four thousand stalls of horses, and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he reigned over all the kings from the River even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king gave silver in Jerusalem, as stones, and gave cedar trees as the wild fig trees, that are abundant in the plain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they brought unto Solomon horses out of Egypt, and out of all lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the rest of the acts of Solomon first and last, are they not written in the book of Nathan the Prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the Seer against Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem: for to Shechem came all Israel to make him king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard it (which was in Egypt, whither he had fled from the presence of Solomon the king) he returned out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sent and called him: so came Jeroboam and all Israel, and communed with Rehoboam, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make thou the grievous servitude of thy father, and his sore yoke that he put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, Depart yet three days, then come again unto me. And the people departed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood before Solomon his father, while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye that I may answer this people?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spake unto him, saying, If thou be kind to this people, and please them, and speak loving words to them, they will be thy servants forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he left the counsel of the ancient men that they had given him, and took counsel of the young men that were brought up with him, and waited on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, What counsel give ye, that we may answer this people, which have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke which thy father did put upon us, lighter?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the young men that were brought up with him, spake unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou answer the people that spake to thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter for us: thus shalt thou say unto them, My least part shall be bigger than my father’s loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now whereas my father did burden you with a grievous yoke, I will yet increase your yoke: my father hath chastised you with rods, but I will correct you with scourges.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king had appointed, saying, Come again to me the third day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king answered them sharply: and king Rehoboam left the counsel of the ancient men,
speaker: Narrator

text: And spake to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke grievous, but I will increase it: my father chastised you with rods, but I will correct you with scourges.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the king hearkened not unto the people: for it was the ordinance of God, that the Lord might perform his saying, which he had spoken by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when all Israel saw that the king would not hear them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? for we have none inheritance in the son of Jesse. O Israel, every man to your tents: now see to thine own house, David. So all Israel departed to their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit Rehoboam reigned over the children of Israel, that dwelt in the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Rehoboam sent Hadoram that was over the tribute, and the children of Israel stoned him with stones, that he died: then King Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel rebelled against the house of David unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he gathered of the house of Judah and Benjamin ninescore thousand chosen men of war to fight against Israel, and to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak unto Rehoboam the son of Solomon King of Judah, and to all Israel that are in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return every man to his house: for this thing is done of me. They obeyed therefore the word of the Lord, and returned from going against Jeroboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built strong cities in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built also Bethlehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Beth Zur, and Sochoh, and Adullam,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gath, Mareshah, and Ziph,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which were in Judah and Benjamin strong cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he repaired the strongholds and put captains in them, and store of vittles, and oil and wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in all cities he put shields and spears and made them exceedingly strong: so Judah and Benjamin were his.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Priests and the Levites that were in all Israel, resorted unto him out of all their coasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Levites left their suburbs and their possessions, and came to Judah and to Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons had cast them out from ministering in the Priests’ office unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ordained him Priests for the high places, and for the devils and for the calves which he had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the Levites there came to Jerusalem of all the tribes of Israel, such as set their hearts to seek the Lord God of Israel, to offer unto the Lord God of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon mighty, three years long: for three years they walked in the way of David and Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam took him Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David to wife, and Abihail the daughter of Eliah the son of Jesse,
speaker: Narrator

text: Which bare him sons Jeush, and Shamariah, and Zaham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after her he took Maachah the daughter of Absalom which bare him Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: for he took eighteen wives and threescore concubines, and begat eight and twenty sons, and threescore daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief ruler among his brethren: for he thought to make him King.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he taught him: and dispersed all his sons throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin unto every strong city: and he gave them abundance of vittles, and desired many wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Rehoboam had established the kingdom and made it strong, he forsook the Law of the Lord, and all Israel with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, Shishak the king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem (because they had transgressed against the Lord)
speaker: Narrator

text: With twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsemen, and the people were without number, that came with him from Egypt, even the Lubim, Sukkiim, and the Ethiopians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took the strong cities which were of Judah, and came unto Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Shemaiah the Prophet to Rehoboam, and to the princes of Judah that were gathered together in Jerusalem, because of Shishak, and said unto them, Thus saith the Lord, Ye have forsaken me, therefore have I also left you in the hands of Shishak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the princes of Israel, and the King humbled themselves, and said, The Lord is just.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves, therefore I will not destroy them, but I will send them deliverance shortly, and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless they shall be his servants: so shall they know my service, and the service of the kingdoms of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the King’s house: he took even all, and he carried away the shields of gold, which Solomon had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: In stead whereof King Rehoboam made shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the chief of the guard, that waited at the door of the king’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the king entered into the house of the Lord, the guard came and bare them and brought them again unto the guard chamber.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because he humbled himself, the wrath of the Lord turned from him, that he would not destroy all together. And also in Judah the things prospered.
speaker: Narrator

text: So King Rehoboam was strong in Jerusalem and reigned: for Rehoboam was one and forty years old, when he began to reign, and reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to put his Name there. And his mother’s name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did evil: for he prepared not his heart to seek the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The acts also of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the book of Shemaiah the Prophet, and Iddo the Seer, in rehearsing the genealogy? and there was war always between Rehoboam and Jeroboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David, and Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, began Abijah to reign over Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He reigned three years in Jerusalem: (his mother’s name also was Michaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah) and there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah set the battle in array with the army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men. Jeroboam also set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men which were strong and valiant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah stood up upon mount Zemaraim, which is in mount Ephraim, and said, O Jeroboam, and all Israel, hear you me,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ought you not to know that the Lord God of Israel hath given the kingdom over Israel to David forever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat the servant of Solomon the son of David is risen up, and hath rebelled against his lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: And there are gathered to him vain men and wicked, and made themselves strong against Rehoboam the son of Solomon: for Rehoboam was but a child and tender hearted, and could not resist them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore ye think that ye be able to resist against the kingdom of the Lord, which is in the hands of the sons of David, and ye be a great multitude, and the golden calves are with you which Jeroboam made you for gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have ye not driven away the Priests of the Lord the sons of Aaron and the Levites, and have made you Priests like the people of other countries? whosoever cometh to consecrate with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a Priest of them that are no gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we belong unto the Lord our God, and have not forsaken him, and the Priests the sons of Aaron minister unto the Lord, and the Levites in their office.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they burn unto the Lord every morning and every evening burnt offerings and sweet incense, and the bread is set in order upon the pure table, and the candlestick of gold with the lamps thereof, to burn every evening: for we keep the watch of the Lord our God: but ye have forsaken him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, this God is with us as a captain, and his Priests with the sounding trumpets to cry an alarm against you. O ye children of Israel, fight not against the Lord God of your fathers: for ye shall not prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jeroboam caused an ambushment to compass, and come behind them, when they were before Judah, and the ambushment behind them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judah looked, and behold, the battle was before and behind them, and they cried unto the Lord, and the Priests blew with the trumpets,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Judah gave a shout: and even as the men of Judah shouted, God smote Jeroboam and also Israel before Abijah and Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah and his people slew a great slaughter of them, so that there fell down wounded of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel were brought under at that time: and the children of Judah prevailed, because they stayed upon the Lord God of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, even Bethel and the villages thereof, and Jeshanah with her villages, and Ephron with her villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jeroboam recovered no strength again in the days of Abijah, but the Lord plagued him, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abijah waxed mighty, and married fourteen wives, and begat two and twenty sons, and sixteen daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the acts of Abijah, and his manners and his sayings, are written in the story of the Prophet Iddo.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David, and Asa his son reigned in his stead: in whose days the land was quiet ten years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa did that was good and right in the eyes of the Lord his God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he took away the altars of the strange gods, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves,
speaker: Narrator

text: And commanded Judah to seek the Lord God of their fathers, and to do according to the Law and the Commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places, and the images: therefore the Kingdom was quiet before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built also strong cities in Judah, because the land was in rest, and he had no war in those years: for the Lord had given him rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore he said to Judah, Let us build these cities, and make walls about, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is before us: because we have sought the Lord our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side: so they built and prospered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa had an army of Judah, that bare shields and spears, three hundred thousand, and of Benjamin that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there came out against him Zerah of Ethiopia with an host of ten hundred thousand, and three hundred chariots, and came unto Mareshah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa went out before him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah, beside Mareshah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa cried unto the Lord his God, and said, Lord, it is nothing with thee to help with many, or with no power: help us, O Lord our God: for we rest on thee, and in thy Name are we come against this multitude: O Lord, thou art our God: let not man prevail against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord smote the Ethiopians before Asa and before Judah, and the Ethiopians fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa and the people that was with him, pursued them unto Gerar. And the Ethiopians’ host was overthrown, so that there was no life in them: for they were destroyed before the Lord and before his host: and they carried away a mighty great spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they smote all the cities round about Gerar: for the fear of the Lord came upon them, and they spoiled all the cities, for there was exceeding much spoil in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, and they smote the tents of cattle, and carried away plenty of sheep and camels, and returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit of God came upon Azariah the son of Obed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went out to meet Asa, and said unto him, O Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin, hear ye me, The Lord is with you, while ye be with him: and if ye seek him, he will be found of you, but if ye forsake him, he will forsake you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now for a long season Israel hath been without the true God, and without Priest to teach, and without Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whosoever returned in his affliction to the Lord God of Israel, and sought him, he was found of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in that time there was no peace to him, that did go out and go in: but great troubles were to all the inhabitants of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nation was destroyed of nation, and city of city: for God troubled them with all adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak: for your work shall have a reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Obed the Prophet, he was encouraged, and took away the abominations out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken of mount Ephraim, and he renewed the altar of the Lord, that was before the porch of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and the strangers with them out of Ephraim, and Manasseh, and out of Simeon: for there fell many to him out of Israel, when they saw that the Lord his God was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they assembled to Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they offered unto the Lord the same time of the spoil which they had brought, even seven hundred bullocks, and seven thousand sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made a covenant to seek the Lord God of their fathers, with all their heart, and with all their soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whosoever will not seek the Lord God of Israel, shall be slain, whether he were small or great, man or woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they sware unto the Lord with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Judah rejoiced at the oath: for they had sworn unto the Lord with all their heart, and sought him with a whole desire, and he was found of them. And the Lord gave them rest round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Asa deposed Maachah his mother from her regency, because she had made an idol in a grove: and Asa brake down her idol, and stamped it, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the high places were not taken away out of Israel: yet the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated, and that he had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was no war unto the five and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the six and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa came Baasha king of Israel up against Judah, and built Ramah, to let none pass out or go in to Asa king of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of the Lord, and of the king’s house, and sent to Ben-Hadad king of Aram that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a covenant between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent thee silver and gold: come, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ben-Hadad hearkened unto King Asa, and sent the captains of the army which he had, against the cities of Israel. And they smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel Maim, and all the store cities of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Baasha heard it, he left building of Ramah, and let his work cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa the king took all Judah, and carried away the stones of Ramah and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha did build, and he built therewith Geba and Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that same time Hanani the Seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said unto him, Because thou hast rested upon the king of Aram, and not rested in the Lord thy God, therefore is the host of the king of Aram escaped out of thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Ethiopians and the Lubim, were they not a great host with chariots and horsemen, exceedingly many? yet because thou didst rest upon the Lord, he delivered them into thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the eyes of the Lord behold all the earth, to show himself strong with them that are of perfect heart toward him: thou hast then done foolishly in this: therefore from henceforth thou shalt have wars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa was wroth with the Seer, and put him into a prison: for he was displeased with him, because of this thing. And Asa oppressed certain of the people at the same time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, the acts of Asa first and last, lo, they are written in the book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa in the nine and thirtieth year of his reign was diseased in his feet, and his disease was extreme: yet he sought not the Lord in his disease, but to the Physicians.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Asa slept with his fathers, and died in the one and fortieth year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they buried him in one of his sepulchers, which he had made for himself in the city of David, and laid him in the bed, which they had filled with sweet odors and divers kinds of spices made by the art of the Apothecary: and they burnt odors for him with an exceeding great fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead, and prevailed against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put garrisons in all the strong cities of Judah, and set bands in the land of Judah and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the first ways of his father David, and sought not Baalim,
speaker: Narrator

text: But sought the Lord God of his father, and walked in his commandment, and not after the trade of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Lord established the kingdom in his hand, and all Judah brought presents to Jehoshaphat, so that he had of riches and honor in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lifted up his heart unto the ways of the Lord, and he took away moreover the high places and the groves out of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the third year of his reign he sent his princes, Ben-Hail, and Obadiah, and Zechariah, and Nethanel, and Michaiah, that they should teach in the cities of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And with them Levites, Shemaiah, and Nethaniah, and Zebadiah, and Asahel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehonathan, and Adonijah, and Tobijah, and Tobadonijah, Levites, and with them Elishama and Jehoram, Priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they taught in Judah, and had the book of the Law of the Lord with them, and went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fear of the Lord fell upon all the kingdoms of the lands that were round about Judah, and they fought not against Jehoshaphat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat gifts and tribute silver, and the Arabians brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred he goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jehoshaphat prospered and grew up on high, and he built in Judah palaces and cities of store.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had great works in the cities of Judah, and men of war, and valiant men in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the numbers of them after the house of their fathers, In Judah were captains of thousands, Adnah the captain, and with him of valiant men three hundred thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at his hand Jehohanan a captain, and with him two hundred and fourscore thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at his hand Amasiah the son of Zichri, which willingly offered himself unto the Lord, and with him two hundred thousand valiant men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Benjamin, Eliada a valiant man, and with him armed men with bow and shield, two hundred thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at his hand Jehozabad, and with him an hundred and fourscore thousand armed to the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: These waited on the king, besides those which the king put in the strong cities throughout all Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance, but he was joined in affinity with Ahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria: and Ahab slew sheep and oxen for him in great number, and for the people that he had with him, and enticed him to go up unto Ramoth Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahab king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Wilt thou go with me to Ramoth Gilead? And he answered him, I am as thou art, and my people as thy people, and we will join with thee in the war.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat said unto the king of Israel, Ask counsel, I pray thee, at the word of the Lord this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the King of Israel gathered of Prophets four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall we go to Ramoth Gilead to battle, or shall I cease? And they said, Go up: for God shall deliver it into the king’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there here never a Prophet more of the Lord that we might inquire of him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, There is yet one man by whom we may ask counsel of the Lord: but I hate him: for he doth not prophesy good unto me, but always evil: it is Michaiah the son of Imla. Then Jehoshaphat said, Let not the king say so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Israel called an eunuch, and said, Call quickly Michaiah the son of Imla.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Israel, and Jehoshaphat King of Judah sat either of them on his throne clothed in their apparel: they sat even in the threshing floor at the entering in of the gate of Samaria: and all the Prophets prophesied before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron, and said, Thus saith the Lord, With these shalt thou push the Aramites until thou hast consumed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the Prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up in Ramoth Gilead, and prosper: for the Lord shall deliver it unto the hand of the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the messenger that went to call Michaiah, spake to him, saying, Behold, the words of the Prophets declare good to the king with one accord: let thy word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of theirs, and speak thou good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Michaiah said, As the Lord liveth, whatsoever my God saith, that will I speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he came to the king, and the King said unto him, Michaiah, shall we go to Ramoth Gilead to battle, or shall I leave off? And he said, Go ye up, and prosper, and they shall be delivered into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King said to him, How oft shall I charge thee, that thou tell me nothing but the truth in the Name of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, I saw all Israel scattered in the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and the Lord said, These have no master: let them return every man to his house in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Did I not tell thee, that he would not prophesy good unto me, but evil?
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said, Therefore hear ye the word of the Lord: I saw the Lord sit upon his throne, and all the host of heaven standing at his right hand, and at his left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said, Who shall persuade Ahab King of Israel, that he may go up, and fall at Ramoth Gilead? And one spake and said thus, and another said that.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there came forth a spirit and stood before the Lord, and said, I will persuade him. And the Lord said unto him, Wherein?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, I will go out, and be a false spirit in the mouth of all his Prophets. And he said, Thou shalt persuade, and shalt also prevail: go forth and do so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore behold, the Lord hath put a false spirit in the mouth of these thy Prophets, and the Lord hath determined evil against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and smote Michaiah upon the cheek, and said, By what way went the Spirit of the Lord from me, to speak with thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Michaiah said, Behold, thou shalt see that day when thou shalt go from chamber to chamber to hide thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King of Israel said, Take ye Michaiah, and carry him to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king’s son,
speaker: Narrator

text: And say, Thus saith the king, Put this man in the prison house, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Michaiah said, If thou return in peace, the Lord hath not spoken by me. And he said, Hear, all ye people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the King of Israel and Jehoshaphat the King of Judah went up to Ramoth Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat, I will change myself, and enter into the battle: but put thou on thine apparel. So the king of Israel changed himself, and they went into the battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Aram had commanded the captains of the chariots that were with him, saying, Fight you not with small nor great, but against the king of Israel only.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, they said, It is the king of Israel: and they compassed about him to fight. But Jehoshaphat cried, and the Lord helped him and moved them to depart from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when the captains of the chariots saw that he was not the King of Israel, they turned back from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a certain man drew a bow mightily, and smote the King of Israel between the joints of his brigandine: Therefore he said to his chariotman, Turn thine hand, and carry me out of the host: for I am hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the battle increased that day: and the king of Israel stood still in his chariot against the Aramites until even, and died at the time of the sun going down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned safe to his house in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehu the son of Hanani the Seer went out to meet him, and said to King Jehoshaphat, Wouldest thou help the wicked, and love them that hate the Lord? therefore for this thing the wrath of the Lord is upon thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless good things are found in thee, because thou hast taken away the groves out of the land, and hast prepared thine heart to seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem, and returned and went through the people from Beersheba to mount Ephraim, and brought them again unto the Lord God of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set judges in the land throughout all the strong cities of Judah, city by city,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said to the judges, Take heed what ye do: for ye execute not the judgments of man, but of the Lord, and he will be with you in the cause and judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore now let the fear of the Lord be upon you: take heed, and do it: for there is no iniquity with the Lord our God, neither respect of persons, nor receiving of reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover in Jerusalem did Jehoshaphat set of the Levites, and of the Priests and of the chief of the families of Israel, for the judgment and cause of the Lord: and they returned to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he charged them, saying, Thus shall ye do in the fear of the Lord faithfully and with a perfect heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in every cause that shall come to you of your brethren that dwell in your cities, between blood and blood, between law and precept, statutes and judgments, ye shall judge them and admonish them that they trespass not against the Lord, that wrath come not upon you and upon your brethren. This shall ye do and trespass not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, Amariah the Priest shall be the chief over you in all matters of the Lord, and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, a ruler of the house of Judah, shall be for all the King’s affairs, and the Levites shall be officers before you. Be of courage, and do it, and the Lord shall be with the good.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this also came the children of Moab and the children of Ammon, and with them of the Ammonites against Jehoshaphat to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there came that told Jehoshaphat, saying, There cometh a great multitude against thee from beyond the Sea, out of Aram: and behold, they be in Hazazon Tamar, which is En Gedi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the Lord, and proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah gathered themselves together to ask counsel of the Lord: they came even out of all the cities of Judah to inquire of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat stood in the Congregation of Judah and Jerusalem in the house of the Lord before the new court,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, O Lord God of our fathers, art not thou God in heaven? and reignest not thou on all the kingdoms of the heathen? and in thine hand is power and might, and none is able to withstand thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Didst not thou our God cast out the inhabitants of this land before thy people Israel, and gavest it to the seed of Abraham thy friend forever?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they dwelt therein, and have built thee a Sanctuary therein for thy Name, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: If evil come upon us, as the sword of judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we will stand before this house and in thy presence (for thy name is in this house) and will cry unto thee in our tribulation, and thou wilt hear and help.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab, and mount Seir, by whom thou wouldest not let Israel go, when they came out of the land of Egypt: but they turned aside from them, and destroyed them not:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I say, they reward us, in coming to cast us out of thine inheritance, which thou hast caused us to inherit:
speaker: Narrator

text: O our God, wilt thou not judge them? for there is no strength in us to stand before this great multitude that cometh against us, neither do we know what to do: but our eyes are toward thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Judah stood before the Lord with their young ones, their wives, and their children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite of the sons of Asaph, was there, upon whom came the Spirit of the Lord, in the midst of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Hearken ye all Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem, and thou, King Jehoshaphat: thus saith the Lord unto you, Fear you not, neither be afraid for this great multitude: for the battle is not yours, but God’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tomorrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the cleft of Ziz, and ye shall find them at the end of the brook before the wilderness of Jeruel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not need to fight in this battle: stand still, move not, and behold the salvation of the Lord towards you: O Judah, and Jerusalem, fear ye not, neither be afraid: tomorrow go out against them, and the Lord will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jehoshaphat bowed down with his face to the earth, and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before the Lord, worshipping the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites of the children of the Kohathites, and of the children of the Korahites stood up to praise the Lord God of Israel with a loud voice on high.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they arose early in the morning, they went forth to the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they departed, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear ye me, O Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem: put your trust in the Lord your God, and ye shall be assured: believe his Prophets, and ye shall prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had consulted with the people, and appointed singers unto the Lord, and them that should praise him that is in the beautiful Sanctuary, in going forth before the men of arms, and saying, Praise ye the Lord, for his mercy lasteth forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they began to shout, and to praise, the Lord laid ambushments against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir, which were come against Judah, and they slew one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Ammon and Moab rose against the inhabitants of mount Seir, to slay and to destroy them: and when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, every one helped to destroy another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Judah came toward Mizpah in the wilderness, they looked unto the multitude: and behold, the carcasses were fallen to the earth, and none escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jehoshaphat and his people came to take away the spoil of them, they found among them in abundance both of substance and also of bodies laden with precious jewels, which they took for themselves, till they could carry no more: they were three days in gathering of the spoil: for it was much.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Berachah: for there they blessed the Lord: therefore they called the name of that place, The valley of Berachah unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then every man of Judah and Jerusalem returned with Jehoshaphat their head to go again to Jerusalem with joy: for the Lord had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Jerusalem with viols, and with harps, and with trumpets, even unto the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fear of God was upon all the kingdoms of the earth, when they had heard that the Lord had fought against the enemies of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the kingdom of Jehoshaphat was quiet, and his God gave him rest on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah, and was five and thirty years old, when he began to reign: and reigned five and twenty years in Jerusalem, and his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he walked in the way of Asa his father, and departed not there from, doing that which was right in the sight of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit the high places were not taken away: for the people had not yet prepared their hearts unto the God of their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Concerning the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is mentioned in the book of the kings of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet after this did Jehoshaphat king of Judah join himself with Ahaziah king of Israel, who was given to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he joined with him, to make ships to go to Tarshish: and they made the ships in Ezion Geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavah of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, Because thou hast joined thyself with Ahaziah, the Lord hath broken thy works: and the ships were broken, that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoshaphat then slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Jehoram his son reigned in his stead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had brethren the sons of Jehoshaphat, Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariah, and Michael, and Shephatiah. All these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their father gave them great gifts of silver and of gold, and of precious things, with strong cities in Judah, but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram: for he was the eldest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehoram rose up upon the kingdom of his father, and made himself strong, and slew all his brethren with the sword, and also of the princes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoram was two and thirty years old, when he began to reign, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as the house of Ahab had done: for he had the daughter of Ahab to wife, and he wrought evil in the eyes of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit the Lord would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and because he had promised to give a light to him, and to his sons forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days Edom rebelled from under the hand of Judah, and made a king over them.
speaker: Narrator
